microsoft-extensions-ai.title: Microsoft.Extensions.AI
microsoft-extensions-ai.shortDescription: Unified abstraction for integrating generative AI services into your .NET applications.

content.mainTitle: Microsoft.Extensions.AI: a unified abstraction for generative AI in .NET
content.intro: Microsoft.Extensions.AI is a library that provides standardized abstractions for integrating generative AI services (chat, embeddings, image generation) into your .NET applications. It follows the same dependency injection and middleware patterns you already know from the .NET ecosystem.

useCases.title: Main use cases:
items: Integrate chat models (OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, etc.) with a unified API
Generate embeddings for semantic search or RAG
Add observability (OpenTelemetry), caching and rate limiting
Switch AI providers without rewriting your code

content.summary: Microsoft.Extensions.AI provides standardized interfaces (IChatClient, IEmbeddingGenerator, IImageGenerator) and middleware components to enrich your AI pipelines with resilience, logging and caching.

packages.title: The packages
packages.description: The library is divided into two main packages:

abstractions.title: Microsoft.Extensions.AI.Abstractions
abstractions.description: Contains the base interfaces (IChatClient, IEmbeddingGenerator, IImageGenerator). Libraries providing AI clients typically reference only this package.

core.title: Microsoft.Extensions.AI
core.description: Main package that includes abstractions + high-level utilities (middleware, builder patterns, dependency injection). This is the package you reference in your applications.

installation.title: Installation
installation.code:
# Main package
dotnet add package Microsoft.Extensions.AI

# Or only abstractions (for libraries)
dotnet add package Microsoft.Extensions.AI.Abstractions

chatClient.title: IChatClient
chatClient.description: Interface for chat models (LLM). Supports multi-turn conversations, multimodal content (text, images, audio) and streaming.

embeddingGenerator.title: IEmbeddingGenerator<TInput, TEmbedding>
embeddingGenerator.description: Generates embeddings (vectors) from text or other inputs. Useful for semantic search, clustering, or RAG systems.

imageGenerator.title: IImageGenerator (experimental)
imageGenerator.description: Generates images from text prompts. Supports configuration (size, format) and composition with middleware.

basicChat.title: Basic chat with IChatClient
basicChat.description: In this example, IChatClient is injected via DI and used to send a simple message.

streaming.title: Response streaming
streaming.description: For long responses, use CompleteStreamingAsync to receive tokens as they arrive.

middleware.title: Middleware: OpenTelemetry + Caching
middleware.description: Easily add observability and caching to your pipelines:
middleware.explanation: Middleware automatically applies to all IChatClient calls. You can chain multiple middlewares (logging, rate limiting, retry, etc.).

embeddings.title: Embedding generation
embeddings.description: Use IEmbeddingGenerator to create vectors from text.

items.title: Portability
items.description: Switch providers (OpenAI → Azure OpenAI → others) without touching your business logic.

items.title: Testability
items.description: Easily mock IChatClient or IEmbeddingGenerator in your unit tests.

items.title: Middleware ecosystem
items.description: Leverage the .NET ecosystem: OpenTelemetry, caching, rate limiting, resilience.

items.title: Dependency injection
items.description: Native integration with IServiceCollection and familiar .NET patterns.

items.title: Consistent API
items.description: A single API for all your generative AI needs (chat, embeddings, images).

items.rule: Use abstractions in your business code
items.reason: Don't depend directly on a specific SDK (e.g., OpenAI SDK). This facilitates testing and migration.
Use UseOpenTelemetry() to track costs, latencies and errors of your AI calls.
Reduce costs and latency by caching identical responses.
Combine with Microsoft.Extensions.Resilience to add retry, circuit breaker, etc.
Configure your clients in Startup/Program.cs, inject them via DI.
